title: Use uploaded photo exactly as-is in Home “Our Mission” section

requirements.summary: Copy the uploaded image into frontend public static assets without any processing or modification.
acceptanceCriteria: A file derived from the user upload "HR Academy 1-2.jpeg" exists under frontend/public/assets/generated/ with identical visual content to the upload.
The asset is served directly from the public folder (not through backend blob storage) and is not processed/optimized by any runtime code.
No additional generated/edited variant of the image is created (only a direct copy stored as a static asset).

file_operations.description: Add a direct, byte-for-byte copy of the uploaded file "HR Academy 1-2.jpeg" as a static public asset at this exact path/filename; do not resize, recompress, crop, convert, strip metadata, or otherwise alter the file in any way.

requirements.summary: Render the uploaded image in the Home page “Our Mission” section using a direct static asset reference with no visual-altering styles.
acceptanceCriteria: The “Our Mission” section on the Home page renders the uploaded photo from the static asset path in frontend/public/assets/generated/.
The rendered image is not clipped (no border-radius masking), not filtered, and not overlaid; it appears as the original rectangular photo.
The image remains responsive (can scale to container width) without changing aspect ratio or cropping any part of the photo.

file_operations.description: Update the Mission section image to use src="/assets/generated/hr-academy-1-2-uploaded.dim_1280x360.jpeg" and remove any classes/styles that visually alter the image (e.g., rounded corners/clipping, overlays/opacity, CSS filters, object-fit cropping), keeping it responsive via width scaling with height auto.
